oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Receipt for rifle from Virgie B. Choat
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Receipts; Rifles; Tennessee -- Adjutant-General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Receipt to Virgie B. Choat for one rifle valued at $16.00, reading, "In obedience to General order No. 1 issued by the Governor and Commander in Chief in accordance with a recent act of the Tennessee Legislature, I have proceeded to have valued the arms of the 101st Regiment in Compliance with the law." Signed by Colonel W. P. Kendrick of the 101st Regiment, Tennessee Militia.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tennessee -- Adjutant-General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: General orders are published directives issued by a commander, binding upon all personnel under his command to affect policies or procedures unique to a unit's situation and not addressed by service regulations. General orders have the force of law within the unit where they are issued. In this case the "commander" is the governor of the state, "commander in chief" of the state's militia. The order involves the requisition and assessment of private arms for military service.
